#Text=Actress and singer Debbie Reynolds dies , one day after daughter 's death
#Text=Thursday , December 29 , 2016
#Text=Acclaimed actor and singer Debbie Reynolds died at the age of 84 yesterday at Cedars-Sinai Hospital in Los Angeles , California .
#Text=Her son , Todd Fisher , said around noon yesterday she suffered a stroke brought on by the stress of the death of her daughter , Carrie Fisher .
#Text=Reynolds ' credits include lead roles in films Singin ' in the Rain , Bundle of Joy , and The Unsinkable Molly Brown , the last of which earned her an Academy Award nomination .
#Text=She worked to preserve Hollywood history and memorabilia for posterity and , like Carrie Fisher , as an advocate for mental health awareness .
#Text=Debbie Reynolds at home in 1987 .
#Text=Image : Allan Warren .
#Text=Born Mary Francis Reynolds in 1932 , she was given the stage name " Debbie " by Warner Brothers director Jack Warner , which she would later say was done without her permission .
#Text=She would go on to spend twenty years with MGM studios .
#Text=Reynolds received a Tony Award nomination for her acting in the 1973 revival of Irene .
#Text=Reynolds ' business interests included owning various private museums of film memorabilia as part of her personal Hollywood history preservation project .
#Text=She would often purchase and hold items such as Marilyn Monroe ' s dress from The Seven Year Itch and Elizabeth Taylor ' s Cleopatra headdress until they could be displayed to the public .
#Text=More recently , she was nominated for an Emmy Award in 2000 for a Will & Grace recurring role and appeared as the main character 's mother in HBO ' s Behind the Candelabra .
#Text=She worked as a voice actress on animated productions such as the children 's show Kim Possible and the more adult Family Guy .
#Text=She was honored with the 2016
#Text=Academy Awards Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award and a Lifetime Achievement Award from the Screen Actors Guild in 2015 .
#Text=In Reynolds ' personal life , her first husband and father of her two children , Eddie Fisher , very publicly left her for her friend Elizabeth Taylor .
#Text=She declared bankruptcy in 1997 after a failed casino project .
#Text=Carrie

#Text=Fisher was an actor , author , and mental health advocate best known for acting in the Star Wars film series and for her novel Postcards from the Edge , which had a character inspired by her mother , Reynolds .
#Text=Fisher was taken ill while flying from London to Los Angeles and died on Tuesday .
#Text=Fisher and Reynolds did not speak for several years , though this rift was long over by the time of Fisher 's death .

#Text=According to Todd Fisher , he and his mother had been discussing his sister 's funeral at his home shortly before the stroke ; Reynolds said to him , " I miss her so much , I want to be with Carrie .

#Text=Reynolds is survived by son Todd Fisher and granddaughter Billie Lourd .
